attributes.action: Conduct proper research and maintain an open mind on the subject of road pricing
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Apparently "The government's proposal to introduce road pricing will mean you having to purchase a tracking device for your car and paying a monthly bill to use it. The tracking device will cost about £200 and in a recent study by the BBC, the lowest monthly bill was £28 for a rural florist and £194 for a delivery driver. A non working mother who used the car to take the kids to school paid £86 in one month."

Please will the government continue conduct its own research as it has promised, and publish the results for the nation to see.
